Adele DeGarde https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adele_DeGarde 0 Adele DeGarde (May 3, 1899 – November 1972), a.k.a. Adele De Garde, was an American silent film actress, who appeared in 114 films between 1908 and 1918. Born Adelaide De Gard in Brooklyn, New York, DeGarde was a Biograph Studios child star in the early part of the 20th century. Later she became a Vitagraph Studios leading lady.In 1939, she attended an Old Home Week at Ohrbach's in New York with other movie actors such as Mae Murray and June Elvidge. Adele_DeGarde ( May_3_,_1899 – November_1972 ) , a.k.a._Adele_De_Garde , was an_American_silent_film_actress , who appeared in 114_films between 1908_and_1918 . Born Adelaide_De_Gard in Brooklyn , New_York , DeGarde was a_Biograph_Studios_child_star in the_early_part of the_20th_century . Later she became a_Vitagraph_Studios leading lady.In_1939 , she attended an_Old_Home_Week at Ohrbach 's in New_York with other_movie_actors such_as Mae_Murray and June_Elvidge .
